page.title: 14CIVIL WAR HIGH ERCALL
page.content: In 1645 the Civil War started. It was King Charles and his Cavaliers against Oliver Cromwell with his Roundheads. Oliver Cromwell had a siege on High Ercall Hall for 2 weeks but the Royalists forced them out. The Hall became a fortress for King Charles. On July 4th 1645 there was a second siege with 1100 men. 100 men were killed and 350 Roundheads captured. There were only 3 Garrisons of King Charles in Salop. They were High Ercall, Bridgnorth and Ludlow. High Ercall fell first, then Bridgnorth and then Ludlow. But there were still Cavaliers in the Hall so the Roundheads went back to the Hall with a battery of cannons and battered the Hall for 9 hours. Then the Hall surrendered.
